turn.0: Hi, I'm your automated assistant. I can answer your questions about Chow mein.
turn.1: What is the difference between chow mein and lo mein?
turn.2: Crispy chow mein is usually topped with a thick brown sauce, while steamed chow mein is mixed with soy sauce before being served.
turn.3: Are there any other interesting aspects about this article?
turn.4: There is a regional difference in the US between the East and West Coast use of the term "chow mein".
turn.5: What is the difference in how it is prepared?
turn.6: On the East Coast, "chow mein" is always the crispy or "Hong Kong style".
turn.8: At some restaurants located in those areas, the crispy chow mein noodles are sometimes deep fried and could be crispy "like the ones in cans" or "fried as crisp as hash browns".
turn.10: At a few East Coast locations, "chow mein" is also served over rice.
turn.12: There, the steamed style using soft noodles is a separate dish called "lo mein".
